explanation: equivalent to the `a` sound in father or car
equivalent to the `b` sound in boy or book
equivalent to the `g` sound in go or game
equivalent to the `d` sound in dog or day
equivalent to the `e` sound in egg or desk
equivalent to the `v` sound in very or love
equivalent to the `z` sound in zoo or buzz
aspirated `t` sound like the `t` in 'top' or 'tap' but softer
equivalent to the `ee` sound in bee or see
ejective `k` sound - similar to the `k` sound `bake` or `take`
equivalent to the `l` sound in love or ball
equivalent to the `m` sound in mother or home
equivalent to the `n` sound in no or fun
equivalent to the `o` sound in home or `oa` sound in 'boat'
ejective `p` sound - similar to the `p` sound `port` or `pp` sound in `pepper`
equivalent to the `s` sound in measure or vision
rolled `r` sound like Spanish rr
equivalent to the `s` sound in sun or pass
ejective `t` sound - similar to the `t` sound `stop` or `tt` sound in `tattoo`
equivalent to the `oo` sound in moon or boot
aspirated `p` sound - similar to the `p` sound `p` or `pp` sound in `pepper`
aspirated `k` sound - similar to the `c` sound in cat or `k` sound in book
voiced velar fricative - like gargling softly. Similar to the French r sound.
ejective uvular stop - no equivalent in English. Much deeper than English k
equivalent to the `sh` sound in shoe or wish
equivalent to the `ch` sound in church or batch
equivalent to the `ts` sound in tsunami or bits
equivalent to the `ds` sound in beds or hands
ejective `ts` sound - more forceful than English ts
ejective `ch` sound - more forceful than English ch
equivalent to the `ch` sound in Scottish loch or German ach
equivalent to the `j` sound in judge or bridge
equivalent to the `h` sound in house or hello
